column4: NeoMatrix:What format can I save it as so it can be read in text format on windows?
if you: cat dmesg > some_file.rtf and take it to windows, MS word should open it properly
just please, for heaven's sake tell me you know about pastebin or nopaste and aren't going to paste it in here! :D

wow...there's so many floppy errors that you're USB errors have been wiped off the file.  Are you haveing trouble with ALL USB devices or just drives, etc? (also, please respong w/ my full name in the message. my client will alert me to your response that way)
It's all usb devices, drives, mice etc
did it work before, or has it never worked?
what type of computer are you using? and which version of ubuntu?
ubuntu 6.06, I'm using a time PC that came out in the early days of XP, I can't remember the accual model number and I can't find it on the computer
I have 4 USB ports and none work

do you know what type of chipset it has controling the USB? (VIA, INTEL, etc)  or if there's any way you can restart the system and get me a fresh dmesg w/o all the floppy errs I can help.  I think ububtu just doesn't recognize your usb
BIOS says onchip USB controler, I'm rebooting
I don't see anything dealing with loading a USB driver (host controller).  It's possible that your USB is damaged, or not recognized by ubuntu.
You could possibly check with someone else how you might try and recompile your kernel with proper drivers for your system, or add a recognizable usb controller
I'm not too clear on rebuilding a ubuntu kernel yet, so I won't be much help there
